metadata.story_name:
'Hephaestus Shuffle (n., colloquial):
    A crime perpetrated on a person, usually human, who is new to, or otherwise unfamiliar with, Hephaestus Station; a prank, ruse, or flim-flam. Crime class C.'
(excerpt from The Young Lawman's Dictionary of Minor Offenses, Templeton-Rhettlock Press, 3312)


  Hephaestus Station, shining crown jewel of the Novik sector. A one-stop shop for everything everyone in the universe could need. Legal or illegal, over or under the counter, from Templeton-Rhettlock's many quality novelty goods to smuggled alien body parts, Hephaestus station caters to the whims of every space jockey, displaced dictator-in-exile, and alien time-hopper that the universe has to offer. 

  Those who make their living on Hephaestus Station are rare breeds, the kind of entrepreneurial spirits with surprisingly low scruples that seem to crop up anywhere there's money to be made. Whether they're out to line their pockets, bring down empires, or just get off-station; whatever names they choose for themselves, the people in Cop Sector have just one name for them- Shufflers.

(Custom cards welcome)

writing_prompt: On Hephaestus Station, a decaying haven of opportunity orbiting a mined-out world, the arrival of a supertanker brings together a motley crew of smugglers, dockworkers, and shadowy figures. What secrets, schemes, or surprises might unfold in the chaotic dance of survival and ambition?

metadata.story_name:
(From the back of the box)

The ships aren't coming back. 

You stood and held this fort by blood and sweat and thunderous cordite prayers, made sure every last Amalgam citizen was on board those dropships. They said they'd be back for you. But the ships aren't coming back. 

This planet is lost. Even now the stars warp overhead as something pale and sickly blots the twin moons. Even now the fog creeps in on the horizon, only visible out of the corner of your eye. Even now you sometimes see dark and terrible things moving across your vision, like pressure spots on your eyes. 

This planet is lost. The ships aren't coming back.

You have only one recourse- escape. To get back to the Amalgam. Back to the fleet. Back to the ships. 

There may be a way out, somewhere in the waste. There may not be. But you have to try.

(C) 31,777 Laughing Lizard Games'n'Toys

(Banner Photo courtesy of Wikimedia Commons).

writing_prompt: The creeping grey fog known as the Loss has claimed countless worlds, and now it comes for Belfathan. With one hour to prepare, you and the other survivors must decide what to salvage, what to leave behind, and how to escape before the horrors arrive.
